ETYMOLOGY: From Latin dīrēctus, past participle of dirigere ('to set straight, guide, arrange'), combined with the suffix -or (denoting an agent or person who performs an action).

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person appointed to manage or oversee the affairs of a company, institution, or organization, often a member of the board (Board of Directors).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 董事；理事；（公司或机构的）主管
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She was recently elected as a non-executive director of the multinational corporation.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她最近被选为那家跨国公司的非执行董事。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The person who supervises the actors and controls the artistic and technical aspects of a film, play, television program, or other artistic production.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The director decided to reshoot the final scene for better emotional impact.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这位导演决定重拍最后一幕以获得更好的情感冲击力。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A person who is in charge of a department, institution, or activity, or who gives instructions.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The director of the local museum oversaw the installation of the new Egyptian exhibit.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 当地博物馆的主任负责监督新的埃及展品的安装工作。
